review.title: not recommended for the family
review.reviewText:
i was looking for the huts in goa , while surfing on net found pams pirachie to be good but not found the availability , the madam of Expedia on toll free no suggested some - in which this hotel as finalized by us.

it was very disappointing to see the pams san francisco , very poor room , made of ply woods , lots of mosquito, bad toilet and also unsafe , leopards, cockroaches, no hot water facility etc

i cant imagine my one night stay in same. it was booked for two night i asked the owner to change or alter also complaint about all such but he didnt.

i would say the expedia people also do not full information about the hotels which they recommend to visitors.

very bad -while booking through expedia we have to think thrice.
review.positiveRemarks: nothing toooooo far from panaji almost 68km 2 hrs drive entrance of hotel is embarassing and no proper parking facility its on last beach of goa
review.locationRemarks: one can spend a leisure time there and enjoy dolphin show best options of huts are available at good price

review.title: Go for it if you have no other option
review.reviewText: I reached there at around 9 in the morning... I was greeted with an unwelcoming gesture that I can not do check-in before 12.. the staff made it doubly sure that 12 means 12... I lived in a hut..the wooden floor of it was broken at places..the quilt wasn't worth using..When I mentioned about few other issues stressing that a bad experience may discourage me to suggest this hotel to others.. they seemed uncaring and undeterred giving me an overall impression that I should have booked another hotel instead...

review.title: Nice camping.
review.reviewText: Was good camping, unfortunately didnt work wifi but staff didnt do anything with this problem.

review.title: Disappointed by beach hut at Palolem
review.reviewText:
This was our third trip to our favourite beach Palolem in south Goa but our first beach hut experience.
We booked Camp Sanfrancisco from expedia's website which was easy enough.
Our trip was planned at the last moment so we were left with little choice with regards to accommodation on the beach.
We booked the AC room directly on the beach front.
The room was basic. The AC didn't work properly. It barely cooled the room in the middle of the day.
The taps in the bathroom were leaking but most upsetting so was the toilet every time we flushed.
The staff appeared demoralized which was contrary to most of the staff at other places at the beach front where we had meals.
And it wasn't cheap. We certainly felt we did not get our money's worth.
I wouldn't recommend this accommodation to friends or family.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is excellent. Immediately beach front and not to near nor far from the village centre for amenities. Its quiet at night as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs better leadership from the owner. Didn't feel there was much contribution from them during the stay. The staff ran the place almost autonomously
review.locationRemarks: It is on Palolem beach. Their is live good quality music most nights. Silent dance parties on practically alternative nights. The dolphin boat trip

review.reviewText: Camp San Francisco was a great place. Basic huts right on the beach was exactly what we wanted. Staff were eager to help with any request. Only down side was an overly persistent souvenir shop attendant. Overall a great stay for the price.

review.title: Decent but better choice available
review.reviewText: The resto at the hotel is sea facing and so are the two rooms on the first floor. Food is good on weekends ONLY and that too limited to the dinner menu. Huts could collapse any moment if not taken care of. The washroom is clean and big enough as well. Problem area is the room. It's gloomy and badly finished. Overall, you get what you pay for, but there're better hotels/huts available in the vicinity if you look better. So, look elsewhere.
